name: df-at
body: |- wceq(cat, crab(s0, cch, wbr(c0h, ccv, cv(s0))))
comment: Define the set of atoms in a Hilbert lattice. An atom is a nonzero element of a lattice such that anything less than it is zero, i.e. it is the smallest nonzero element of the lattice. Definition of atom in [Kalmbach] p. 15. See ~ ela and ~ elat2 for membership relations. (Contributed by NM, 14-Aug-2002.) (New usage is discouraged.)
